item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #1
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #1 This debut podcast features a phone conversation with classic underground thrash metal stalwart Katon De Pena of the band HIRAX discussing the early days of thrash metal and the old LA and Orange County club scene of the early '80s. Also featured are classic interview segments from Judas Priest guitar wiz KK Downing and Black Sabbath drummer Bill Ward. And you think you know your metal? Test your metal know-how and see if you can identify these ten classic metal riffs!
item.itunes:subtitle: Guest Katon De Pena from HIRAX
item.itunes:summary: This debut podcast features a phone conversation with classic underground thrash metal stalwart Katon De Pena of the band HIRAX discussing the early days of thrash metal and the old LA and Orange County club scene of the early '80s. item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #2
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #2: Features a very rare and exclusive phone conversation between Bob Nalbandian and long-time friend Patrick Scott. In this very rare interview Patrick talks in length about the NWOBHM and the demo-tape trading scene of the early '80s and reveals some amazing never-before told stories about Metallica during their real garage days! Also features classic interview segments with Frank Marino and Dee Snider. And test your metal knowledge once again as you rack your brain to identify these 10 monumental metal guitar leads!

item.itunes:keywords: hard rock, heavy metal, podcast, hardradio, NWOBHM

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #3
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #3: On this special podcast edition (part two of the NWOBHM feature) in-studio guest and fellow metal-mate Tobe Baad joins Bob Nalbandian to discuss the British and Swedish metal scene of the early '80s. Also revealed in this edition is a monumental masterpiece that has been lurking deep within the bowels from hell (aka: Bob's closet) for several years. If Geraldo only knew back then that the real treasure lies not in King Tut's tomb but right here in my sacred tomb! Exposed for the first time since 1983...The Blessed Nylon Jacket of Metal!
item.itunes:subtitle: Guest Tobe Baad

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #4
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #4: The Bay Area thrash-metal Podcast! Host Bob Nalbandian discusses the early '80s San Francisco metal scene with Bay Area metal pioneers John Strednansky and Bill Hale [former editor in chief and photo editor for the seminal '80s metal magazine Metal Rendezvous]. This episode also features a classic interview segment with System Of A Down from 1999, more classic metal guitar riffs and a phoner with metal expert Sherman P. White.
item.itunes:subtitle: Guests Bill Hale and John Strednansky

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #5
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #5: The Gigantour Special! On this podcast host Bob Nalbandian interviews several of the bands on Gigantour 2006 while during their west coast dates this last September. Included are interview segments with Overkill, Opeth, Sanctity, Into Eternity, The Smash Up, as well as a great interview clip with Megadeth's Dave Mustaine. Also included are interviews with Gene Hoglan from Strapping Young Lad and Michelle Meldrum from the Swedish female metal band Meldrum which were also conducted during the Gigantour. A great episode jammed packed with interviews! Contact: shockwaves@hardradio.com.

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #6
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #6: Included in Episode 6 is an exclusive interview with British author Joel McIver who just released his brand new masterpiece/book Sabbath Bloody Sabbath. Also included: a classic Ozzy interview segment from 1996 and Shockwaves European correspondent Fredrik Hjelm reports from the Iron Maiden show outside the Globe Arena in Stockholm, Sweden. And test your metal-wits once again with these 10 classic metal riffs and leads! Contact: shockwaves@hardradio.com

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #8
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #8: In this episode Bob Nalbandian interviews esteemed metal author and journalist Martin Popoff. The main topic of discussion is Martin's recently released literary gem: BLACK SABBATH: Doom Let Loose, An Illustrated History (ECW Press). In this nostalgic conversation, Martin and I take you on a journey through Black Sabbath's entire album catalog commenting on various aspects of the recordings and the impact it made on our youth. A must listen for any true fan of Black Sabbath!

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #9
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #9: In this special episode host Bob Nalbandian interviews David Ellefson who talks about his past with Megadeth and his present bands F5 and Temple of Brutality. This episode also features a very exclusive interview with John Bush. For the first time, John talks candidly about his current status with Anthrax and what the future holds for Armored Saint. A must listen exclusive interview that can only be heard here at Shockwaves/HardRadio!

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #10
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #10: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews revered bassist Joey Vera who discusses his past and present with Armored Saint, his new solo project A Chinese Fire Drill, his involvement with Fates Warning and Seven Witches, his current production projects as well as his pre-Armored Saint bands with Motley Crue drummer Tommy Lee. Also included on this episode is an interview with Austin, Texas hard rock and metal veteran vocalist Jason McMaster who discusses his current project Broken Teeth as well as his past involvement with Dangerous Toys, Watchtower, Ghadzilla Motor Company and The Union Underground.

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #11
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #11: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews drum legend Vinny Appice (Black Sabbath, Heaven and Hell, 3-Legged Dogg) who discusses the upcoming Heaven and Hell tour, his days with Black Sabbath in the early 80s, the LA metal scene of the late 70s as well as his brand new band 3 Legged Dogg. Also on this episode is an interview with bassist extraordinaire Rev Jones who reveals in detail what really happened with Michael Schenker during the MSG Asia tour. Rev also discusses his other bands and projects Kotack, Fuel, and Black Symphony.

item.description: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO Podcast #12: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews a true metal legend! In this episode, the one and only Metal God ROB HALFORD is the feature interview. Rob discusses his new Internet label venture Metal God Entertainment as well as the forthcoming Judas Priest concept album Nostradamus. Rob also takes us back in time to the early years of Judas Priest discussing their earning of the title Heavy Metal Masters!

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #16
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #16: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews the extraordinary vocalist and bassist Glenn Hughes (Deep Purple, Trapeze, and Hughes-Thrall) who talks about his burgeoning solo career as well as his days with Deep Purple. Also featured on this episode is legendary Scorpions drummer Herman Rarebell who discusses his post-Scorpions projects including his forthcoming solo CD I'm Back, the 60's/70's music scene in Germany, and his triumphant years with the Scorpions as well as the recent Scorpions reunion he recently did along with other former Scorps including Uli Roth, Michael Schenker, and Francis Buchholz.

item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #17: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews guitar virtuoso and long-time friend Marty Friedman. Friedman and Nalbandian discuss the good old days hanging out in Hollywood, Marty's early years with Hawaii and Cacophony, the astounding Mega-years, and Marty's current mega-success in Japan. And we're doing it again! Test you metal mentality with 10 more monumental guitar leads.

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #18
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #18: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews rock journalist/author and notorious "metal dude" Lonn Friend. In this episode Lonn discusses his recent book Life On Planet Rock, his days as editor for the infamous RIP Magazine and host for Headbanger's Ball, the '80s and late '70s metal/prog-rock scene, and the ever-growing porn business. Lonn also shares some incredible stories about Metallica, Nirvana and the historic RIP Magazine parties of the '80s and early '90s. And test your metal knowledge with 10 killer bass riffs!

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #20
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #20: The New Wave of British Heavy Metal Special! Host Bob Nalbandian speaks with key players from the NWOBHM - John Gallagher (Raven), Brian Ross (Blitzkrieg, Avenger, Satan) and Peter Haworth (Legend) - discussing the British metal scene of the early '80s and the impact and influence they and other NWOBHM bands had on today's thrash metal bands as well as their current endeavors. All three artists take the listener on a historic journey to a classic era of British metal! A must listen for any true metal fan!

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #23
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #23: This episode features a classic metal discussion between podcast host Bob Nalbandian and Anthrax/Armored Saint vocalist John Bush. Rather than the standard interview Nalbandian and Bush each give their insight on some of the much publicized recent classic rock/metal reunions including Van Halen, Heaven And Hell, Led Zeppelin, Queen, Alice In Chains, The Doors and many others. Also on this episode Nalbandian interviews William Irwin, the author/editor of 'Metallica And Philosophy: A Crash Course In Brain Surgury.' Topics include the philosophical aspects of James Hetfield's lyrics, Napster, the band's forthcoming release and the ongoing debate of Metallica "selling-out."
item.itunes:subtitle: With John Bush and author William Irwin

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #24
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #24: Host Bob Nalbandian interviews legendary drummer Brian O'Brian from the classic late '70s/early'80s Orange County, CA bluesy hard rock band A La Carte. Brian talks about the classic LA and Orange County club days of the late '70s - The Starwood, The Whisky-A-Go-Go, and the Golden Bear - and tells some hilarious stories about performing with Van Halen, Quiet Riot w/ Randy Rhoads, and Motley Crue's first ever performance opening up for A La Carte. Brian also discusses the upcoming documentary about guitar legend Randy Rhoads. Also on this episode Nalbandian talks shop with seminal heavy metal author/journalist Martin Popoff about his new book The Collector's Guide to Heavy Metal Vol. 3 - The '90s. The two discuss many topics primarily revolving around classic underground rock/metal releases from the '90s.
item.itunes:subtitle: With Brian O'Brian and author Martin Popoff

item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #25: The Best Of The Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast! This is the year-end Anniversary special episode featuring some of the most popular interviews from the critically acclaimed Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast. Host Bob Nalbandian also digs deep into his old interview archives and pulls out a surprisingly rare masterpiece! Included on this episode are classic never before publicly heard excerpts from the very first ever Dave Mustaine/Megadeth interview! This exclusive interview was conducted by Bob Nalbandian in January of 1984 when Megadeth were still in their forming stages. Also included on this "Best Of" episode are classic interview excerpts from Ozzy Osbourne, Rob Halford, John Bush, Marty Friedman, System Of A Down, and part 2 of the Martin Popoff interview. Promoting his latest book, The Collector's Guide to Heavy Metal Vol. 3 - The '90s, the two discuss and debate some of metal's most groundbreaking artists from the nineties. In between the interview segments Bob Nalbandian reveals eight classic, underrated and overlooked albums from the nineties.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shockwaves HardRadio 2007 Best of Podcast

item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #29: The Great JUDAS PRIEST Debate! On this episode host Bob Nalbandian is joined by head of A and R at Roadrunner Records, Monte Conner and author Martin Popoff to discuss and debate on Judas Priest's extensive career as they examine the band's entire catalog. This exclusive 3-way conversation ties in with the release of Martin's band new book on ECW Press entitled Judas Priest: Heavy Metal Painkillers.

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #30
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #30: The Metallica Episode! Host Bob Nalbandian pins down journalist and author of the official Metallica illustrated chronicle; So What! The Good, The Mad, and the Ugly, Steffan Chirazi, as well as Lars's earliest metal comrade and NWOBHM connoisseur John Kornarens for an extraordinary 3-way conversation exploring the earliest years of Metallica's unbelievable journey into becoming the world's biggest heavy metal band. In this profound conversation, the three share their very earliest experiences with this monumental band as well as discuss such compelling topics as Metallica's early LA club performances, the impact of the No Life Till Leather demo and the contributions from the original/former band members, as well as the controversial "selling-out" issue. This is without question one of the most candid and intriguing conversations ever recorded about the early Metallica days told from the very people who were right there in the mix.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Metallica Episode

item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #31: Host Bob Nalbandian discusses metal music and the state of the music business from an A and R perspective with one of the most respected and knowledgeable record company executives when it comes to metal music: Roadrunner Records A and R chief Monte Conner. In this 45-minute discussion Monte talks about the history of Roadrunner Records, gives advice to young metal bands in search of a record deal, and talks about the future of the recording business as well as the future for heavy metal and extreme metal. Also on this episode Bob Nalbandian lays out yet another 10 classic metal riffs/leads for the biggest contest in Shockwaves history! You must listen to this episode for your chance to win a brand new Peavey PXD series guitar!!

item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #34: The Guitar Masters Episode. Featured on this special Shockwaves/HardRadio episode are interviews from some of today’s guitar legends. Shockwaves correspondent John Strednansky reigns over this episode once again as he chats it up with UFO guitar master Vinnie Moore, Mountain guitar legend Leslie West, and Whitesnake’s newest axe-wielder Doug Aldrich. And host Bob Nalbandian thrashes it out with guitar wizard Steve Stevens who recently released a great new solo CD and currently is on the road with Billy Idol. Also included on this episode is a Shockwaves flashback interview excerpt with Michael Schenker.

item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #36: The Guitar Masters Episode Part Two! Host Bob Nalbandian turns over the mic to John Strednansky as he interviews two historic guitar legends: Former Scorpions guitar master Uli Roth and founding Uriah Heep guitarist Mick Box. The two discuss their latest releases as well as some incredible stories from their past and their theories on how they stay relevant in today's market. Also included is an interview segment from yet another guitar legend; Yngwie Malmsteen, and we also announce the winning band from the Indie Metal Music Podcast as well as the contest winner of the Peavey Zodiac DE bass guitar as we reveal the 10 classic metal guitar excerpts!

item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #39: On this episode host Bob Nalbandian digs deep into the vaults and finds treasure! Originally published for his groundbreaking early '80s fanzine THE HEADBANGER, Bob shares with the world for the very first time the first ever interview with MEGADETH from January 1984 as well as a classic 1983 interview he did with the legendary RONNIE JAMES DIO. Both these interviews were conducted over a quarter century ago but surprisingly, the audio still holds up. This is a classic archive episode not to be missed!
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with Dave Mustaine, Ronnie James Dio

item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #40: On this Special 40th Episode of the Shockwaves/HardRadio Podcast host Bob Nalbandian headed up to Weed, CA to visit Sylvia Massey's Radiostar Studios and hang out with Seattle's latest metallic export The Flood while the band was tracking their forthcoming CD. Interviews include The Flood vocalist/mainman Chris Johnson, manager Darrick Jones and producer Sylvia Massey. Also included on this episode is a Metallica update from Shockwaves correspondent Fredrik Hjelm in Copenhagen, Denmark and interviews with Edguy guitarist Jens Ludwig and Stratovarius drummer Jorg Michael conducted by John Strednansky.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Flood, Radiostar, Metallica

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #48
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #48: On this episode host Bob Nalbandian interviews renowned vocalist David Reece (Bangalore Choir, Accept, Sircle of Silence). Currently residing in Germany, David recently reformed the great late '80s blues-based hard rock band Bangalore Choir who just released their new CD Cadence. Also on this episode is a fantastic interview with guitarist Andy Charters and vocalist Nige Roberts of the legendary and pioneering NWOBHM band Marseille who also recently reformed and recorded their new CD Unfinished Business.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with David Reece, Andy Charters, Nige Roberts

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #49
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #49: On this episode host Bob Nalbandian interviews legendary guitarist Marty Friedman, discussing his several musical projects in Japan and his upcoming US summer tour, as well as world renowned guitarist/vocalist David 'Rock' Feinstein of The Rods and Elf. David shares some fond memories about his cousin Ronnie James Dio, who recorded his final vocal session on Rock's latest solo album Bitten By The Beast. Also on this episode is an interview with Texas Hippie Coalition frontman Big Dad Ritch who discusses the band's latest release 'Rollin'.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with Marty Friedman, David Rock Feinstein, Texas Hippie Coalition

item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #50
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #50: On this episode host Bob Nalbandian interviews legendary guitarist Brian Robertson (Thin Lizzy/ Motorhead / Wild Horses) who discusses his new solo project, his time with Thin Lizzy and Motorhead as well as his thoughts on the new Thin Lizzy lineup. Brian also shares some fond memories of the late, great Gary Moore. Also on this episode is an interview with Extreme vocalist Gary Cherone who talks about his new side project Hurtsmile as well as an interview with current Thin Lizzy bassist Marco Mendoza who also has a new solo album/project entitled Casa Mendoza.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with Brian Robertson, Gary Cherone, Marco Mendoza

item.author: shockwaves@hardradio.com (Bob Nalbandian)
item.title: SHOCKWAVES/HARDRADIO #59
item.itunes:author: HardRadio.com
item.description: Shockwaves/HardRadio podcast #58: This is a special 2-part episode with part one featuring returning guests author/journalists Martin Popoff and Joel McIver. Martin and Joel talk about their recent works including books on Glenn Hughes, Motorhead, Randy Rhoads, Deep Purple, Black Sabbath, and Thin Lizzy and Martin, as the research coordinator for the VH-1 Classic series Metal Evolution, gives us an inside scoop on all 11 episodes of this groundbreaking new heavy metal TV series. Part two of this podcast features authors/photographers Brian Lew and Harald Oimoen along with book publisher/author Ian Christe as they discuss their latest coffee table book Murder In The Front Row.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with authors Martin Popoff, Joel McIver, Brian Lew, Harald Oimoen, Ian Christie
